alert.note: Alert for Pribilof Islands (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 31 at 7:18PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...STRONG WINDS DEVELOPING WITH SNOW AND BLOWING SNOW CHANGING TO RAIN TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... A strong low pressure system is poised to move along the Aleutian Chain Tuesday morning before entering the southern Bering Sea Tuesday evening and overnight. Easterly to east-northeasterly winds will pick up Tuesday morning and peak with gusts to 60 mph in the afternoon to early evening. Winds begin to weaken and turn more northeasterly during the late evening and overnight hours. The front will reach the Pribilof Islands late Tuesday morning into the early afternoon hours. Precipitation will begin from south to north as the winds are peaking. There could be enough cold air in place initially that St. Paul Island could experience a period of snow and blowing snow late Tuesday morning into the afternoon hours before mixing with and changing over to rain.
